channel.title: Network on TLDRBins
channel.description: Recent content in Network on TLDRBins

item.title: Firewall (Windows)
item.description: Windows Check Firewall Rules powershell cmd # Check profiles Get-NetFirewallProfile *Evil-WinRM* PS C:\Users\maria> Get-NetFirewallProfile Name : Domain Enabled : False DefaultInboundAction : NotConfigured DefaultOutboundAction : NotConfigured AllowInboundRules : NotConfigured AllowLocalFirewallRules : NotConfigured AllowLocalIPsecRules : NotConfigured AllowUserApps : NotConfigured AllowUserPorts : NotConfigured AllowUnicastResponseToMulticast : NotConfigured NotifyOnListen : False EnableStealthModeForIPsec : NotConfigured LogFileName : %systemroot%\system32\LogFiles\Firewall\pfirewall.log LogMaxSizeKilobytes : 4096 LogAllowed : False LogBlocked : False LogIgnored : NotConfigured DisabledInterfaceAliases : {NotConfigured} ---[SNIP]--- # Check inbound rules Get-NetFirewallRule -Direction InBound -Enabled True PS C:\programdata> Get-NetFirewallRule -Direction Inbound -Enabled True Name : DeliveryOptimization-TCP-In DisplayName : Delivery Optimization (TCP-In) Description : Inbound rule to allow Delivery Optimization to connect to remote endpoints DisplayGroup : Delivery Optimization Group : @%systemroot%\system32\dosvc.

item.title: Network Discovery
item.description: Test Connectivity Linux Windows # Default infinite pings ping -c3 <TARGET> # Default 5 pings ping <TARGET> # Check specific port Test-NetConnection <TARGET> -Port <TARGET_PORT> # With Active Directory Module Installed Get-ADComputer -Filter * | ForEach-Object { $_ | Select-Object Name, @{Name='IPAddress';Expression={(Test-Connection -ComputerName $_.Name -Count 1).IPV4Address}}} Test Reverse Connectivity Linux sudo tcpdump -ni tun0 icmp Sniff Network Traffic Linux # Sniff on network adapter sudo tcpdump -i eth0 -w packets.pcap root@NIX01:/dev/shm# sudo tcpdump -i eth0 -w packets.

item.title: Network Traffic Pivoting
item.description: chisel metasploit ssh socat sliver Basic # Start a local chisel Server ./chisel server --reverse --port 8000 $ ./chisel server --reverse --port 8000 2024/09/23 12:27:03 server: Reverse tunnelling enabled 2024/09/23 12:27:03 server: Fingerprint ikFn6iQOOodxIlcDQI4dvFu1pdHgV5UnHRenxUg0eho= 2024/09/23 12:27:03 server: Listening on http://0.0.0.0:8000 Ports forwarding # In target machine ./chisel client <LOCAL_IP>:8000 R:<TARGET_PORT>:127.0.0.1:<TARGET_PORT> # Mutiple ports fowarding, can be different targets in the same subnet ./chisel client <LOCAL_IP>:8000 R:8080:172.17.0.2:8080 R:5000:172.17.0.3:5000 Socks5 # In target machine .

item.title: Nmap
item.description: Nmap Scan TCP UDP Script target=<TARGET> nmap -p- --min-rate 10000 -oA ./nmap-alltcp $target ports=$(cat nmap-alltcp.nmap| grep -Eo "^[0-9]+" | tr '\n' ',' | sed -r 's/,$//') nmap -p $ports -sCV -oA ./nmap-tcpscripts $target target=<TARGET> nmap -sU --min-rate 10000 -oA ./nmap-udp $target ports=$(cat nmap-udp.nmap| grep -Eo "^[0-9]+" | tr '\n' ',' | sed -r 's/,$//') nmap -p $ports -sU -sCV -oA ./nmap-udpscripts $target Update scripts DB nmap --script-updatedb Search scripts # e.

item.title: openvpn
item.description: Connect to vpn sudo openvpn my_vpn.ovpn

item.title: VPN
item.description: Enum # Check with ikeV1 ike-scan -M <TARGET> # Check with ikeV2 ike-scan -M --ikev2 <TARGET> Connect to VPN strongswan sudo apt install strongswan Settings # Edit /etc/ipsec.secrets %any : PSK <PASSWORD> # Edit /etc/ipsec.conf (copy from ike-scan result) config setup charondebug="all" uniqueids=yes strictcrlpolicy=no conn testvpn authby=secret auto=add ike=3des-sha1-modp1024! esp=3des-sha1! type=transport keyexchange=ikev1 left=<LOCAL> right=<TARGET> rightsubnet=<TARGET>[tcp] Connect # Reset ipsec restart # Connect ipsec up testvpn
